intro: Sulettaria, commonly known as the common sulettaria, is a small flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Sulettaria typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a valuable component of local ecosystems.
